Description: Landscape with Flight into Egypt, record of a painting (whereabouts unknown) from the Liber Veritatis; Mary riding a donkey with an angel near the foreground, an undulating landscape with arch and tower at l, the sea in the distance Pen and brown ink and brown wash, heightened with white; on blue paper
Curator's comments: See 1957,1214.6 for information on the Liber Veritatis. This is a particularly striking scene in which the light suggested beyond the horizon dominates the composition. The biblical figures are interestingly lost within the imposing landscape, given that Claude generally enlarged the figures when translating the scene from the painting to irs record in the Liber. Claude produced this painting for an unspecified patron in Amsterdam, and is now lost. Lit: M. Roethlisberger, Claude Lorrain, The Paintings, London 1961, LV66, pp. 208–209; M. Roethlisberger, ‘Claude Lorrain. The Drawings’, Berkeley & Los Angeles, 1968, no. 518; M. Kitson, ‘Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis’, London 1978, no. 66. Engravings Earlo, 66; Caracciolo, 67.
Bibliographic references: Liber Veritatis 1978 / Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis (66)
Exhibition history: 1977 BM, Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis 1978/9 Oct-Jan, Louvre, 'Claude Lorrain', no. 50 2006-7 Nov - Jan. BM, Nativity show (no cat.)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: William Cavendish, 2nd Duke of Devonshire
Previous owner/ex-collection: Victor Christian William Cavendish, 9th Duke of Devonshire
Acquisition notes: Accepted by H M Government in lieu of tax on the estate of the 9th Duke of Devonshire. See M. Kitson's 'Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis', pp. 28-9, for a full account of the provenance of the sketch-book.
